body: @Slair1 are you going to modularise the handleDisconnectWithInvestigation method?
@rafaelweingartner , yes you can. It seems to be a timing issue. the host does not have a state needed in some occurences and does have that state in other runs.
yes @khos2ow , please replace either one or the other or vice versa. don't forget the test class as well, if you will.
@borisstoyanov a Trillian-Jenkins matrix job (centos6 mgmt + xs71, centos7 mgmt + vmware65, centos7 mgmt + kvmcentos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@blueorangutan package
@borisstoyanov a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1763
Thanks @DaanHoogland!
Hi Rafael, guys. Any resolution regarding this PR? Perhaps this PR as an interim solution until someone has an opportunity to do a more comprehensive solution?
@borisroman are those errors/failures ok?

Let me run smoke tests again, but I think we've seen them quite frequently on random PRs.
@blueorangutan test
@borisstoyanov a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests

ok, thanks.
@DaanHoogland have you approaved this PR?
@ernjvr I think you want to address @rafaelweingartner instead of Rafael. Better change on reaction.

@ernjvr I would go with this one. It does not mean that I like this type of solution. It is a palliative one, and we already have so much of these things around. However, I do understand that to change the database upgrade scheme that we use now is something way more complex (at least to do something good). I would expect us to change the DB schema upgrade method in a future ACS 5 for instance.

@ernjvr have you tested it ?
If you import this sql file into mysql or mariadb, it might work.
However, In my experience, java does not accept procedure in sql. It uses CallableStatement
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/Connection.html#prepareCall(java.lang.String)
If we have no objections I will be merging this one latter today.

@DaanHoogland this one seems to be ready. Would you like to wait for a third and fourth eyes here?

@DaanHoogland @rafaelweingartner can you take a look at the cleanup commit?
I think I leave it as this and don't squash them, what do you say?
Everything seems to be ok. I would leave the commits separated to facilitate reviews.

It seems that everything is ok here, can we proceed with the merge?
@Slair1 can you take a look into travis failures?

@pdion891 do you have a feedback regarding the result of tests conducted by you guys?
I have used this in a test environment to check the backwards compatibility with system VMs PV, and everything is ok with this use case.

Thanks for the tip @DaanHoogland. Understood @rafaelweingartner. Yes @ustcweizhou, I tested with both mysql and java. In my java test class, I invoked the com/cloud/utils/db/ScriptRunner.java to execute the engine/schema/resources/META-INF/db/schema-41000to41100.sql script, since this same class is invoked during the upgrade to execute these schema-xxx.sql scripts.

[system-vm.log](https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/files/1792215/system-vm.log)

Trillian id:
pr2477-t2339-xenserver-71
Good work Wei, Can you add a link to prereq reading and maybe a short usage description?
@rafaelweingartner i did i think but my approval is kind of stale. Let me find time to revisit it, please
@rafaelweingartner no it is fine

The code in itself looks good @khos2ow, except that i am missing a link to the db. How and where is the connection between CloudstackVersion and VersionVO? Not sure if we need to worry to much but it is a reason for extensive testing.
@blueorangutan package
@DaanHoogland a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

flyway get started
https://flywaydb.org/getstarted/how
@ustcweizhou I don't think that is going to propagate the use and understanding of this code a lot, but soit. Let's grow it over time.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1764
Sure, no problem.
@blueorangutan test
@DaanHoogland a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1765
@blueorangutan test matrix
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins matrix job (centos6 mgmt + xs71, centos7 mgmt + vmware65, centos7 mgmt + kvmcentos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@rafaelweingartner we've completed the "before" benchmark (iperf test). the "after" applying patches on Xen hasn't been done yet. I will post the result here when finished. /cc @pdion891

@DaanHoogland there's no relation between `VersionVO` and `CloudStackVersion`. The latter is just a java representation of a _software version_ which is only one field from all the history of versions captured in VersionVO.

LGTM based on the code

Nice PR! I agree with @rafaelweingartner and @DaanHoogland , but I can live without that.

But yes, a method would make testing easier.

LGTM based on code

Can VM HA handle such a failure? Let's say you have two NFS mounts on that host and once fails. You only stop the Agent, but other VMs keep running.

Afaik that can still cause a corruption where a VM is spawned twice in a cluster because the other host can't know if that VM is still running or not.

Our investigators aren't that smart. They rely on ICMP and such which might be blocked.
Nice PR! Shouldn't the XML parser for the VMDef however not be updated as well and have additional tests?

@nvazquez `test_01_service_offering_cpu_limit_use` looks like a regression, can you check?
@DaanHoogland since your approval the code did not change. I only isolated a smoke test case that was causing problems.

Test LGTM, no failures seen. The only affected public facing services are browser related - (1) apache2 on systemvms and (2) jetty powered mgmt server. Given the UI does not support IE, we've been testing against modern browsers such as Chrome and Firefox only, acceptance of the PR should not cause new failures for users. If admins want to enable TLS support (1.0+1.1) for browsers for the UI, they may configure the java.security.ciphers file or explicitly set the `jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms= SSLv2Hello, SSLv3` option to allow both TLSv1, v1.1. With Java8, TLS1.2 is enabled by default.
Merging this PR based on test results and code reviews, thanks.
